definitions.text: pull back or move away or backward
examples: The enemy withdrew
The limo pulled away from the curb
He retired from chess

definitions.text: release from something that holds fast, connects, or entangles
examples: I want to disengage myself from his influence
disengage the gears
recall the defective auto tires
The manufacturer tried to call back the spoilt yoghurt

definitions.text: take back what one has said
examples: He swallowed his words
He sequestered himself in his study to write a book

definitions.text: break from a meeting or gathering
examples: We adjourned for lunch
The men retired to the library
He bowed out when he realized he could no longer handle the demands of the chairmanship
She drew $2,000 from the account
The doctors drew medical supplies from the hospital's emergency bank
he retired from life when his wife died

definitions.text: make a retreat from an earlier commitment or activity
examples: We'll have to crawfish out from meeting with him
He backed out of his earlier promise
The aggressive investment company pulled in its horns

definitions.text: remove something concrete, as by lifting, pushing, or taking off, or remove something abstract
examples: remove a threat
remove a wrapper
Remove the dirty dishes from the table
take the gun from your pocket
This machine withdraws heat from the environment
